explanation: The report is correct. The function calls memcpy(header_malloced, header, header_len) and memcpy(value_malloced, content, content_len) without validating that the source pointers (header, content) are non-NULL and point to objects at least header_len/content_len bytes long. The only checks are mhd_assert(0 != header_len) and mhd_assert(0 != content_len), which only ensure non-zero lengths and do not guarantee pointer validity or object size. Under MISRA C:2023 Rule 21.17, use of memcpy that can read beyond the bounds of the source object is forbidden. As written, the code can result in out‑of‑bounds reads if callers provide a shorter object or NULL pointer, so this is a violation unless there is an external, provable precondition that the pointers and lengths are valid (which is not enforced in the code).
